headline: Georgia lawmakers add courage to state pledge
author: Mark Niesse
sentences:
The Georgia House gave final approval Monday to a bill that would add the word courage? to the states pledge of allegiance, supplementing the ideals of wisdom, justice, and moderation.?
The change is meant to reflect all four cardinal virtues of government identified by the Greek philosopher Plato in his most famous work, the Republic.
The legislation doesnt change Georgias state seal, which contains the words wisdom,? justice? and moderation? displayed on banners wrapped around three pillars supporting the state constitution.

Pledge of allegiance to the Georgia flag
I pledge allegiance to the Georgia flag and to the principles for which it stands: Wisdom, Justice, and Moderation.?
The addition of courage? was sought by Republican members of the state Senate, which recites the pledge before the chamber begins its daily business.

There is no better time than now to acknowledge that courage.?
The House voted 125-23 to approve Senate Bill 152, which now advances to Gov.
The seal also includes a picture of a soldier with his sword drawn, which Gullett said represents the value of courage.
Our pledge was missing courage, ? said state Rep. Joseph Gullett, a Republican from Acworth.
The Georgia pledge isnt often used in schools, other state agencies or the state House.
I can tell you that courage is not lacking in our state.
Brian Kemp for his signature or veto.
